comments.text: On the Privacy pane of Firefox's preferences, there are a number of checkboxes related to cookies, one of which is "accept cookies from sites". When this box is unchecked, cookies may only be set from sites which are manually whitelisted using the "exceptions" button. It should be possible to specify whether each of those sites can set cookies only as a first party, or whether they are also permitted to set cookies as third parties.

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to Tom Lowenthal [:StrangeCharm] from comment #2)
> I don't see this in <about:permissions>. I only see the option to choose
> never/always/per-session. Am I missing something?

I don't know what you're looking at, but the dropdown options should be "Allow", "Allow for Session", "Allow First Party Only", and "Block".  I don't think there are any platform differences.  Are you looking in the Set Cookies dropdown on the about:permissions page?

You need to be using at least Firefox 18 (appears for me in 18.0.2, but not 17ESR) and you need to select a domain in the list to see the new permission.  This permission type is only available as an exception and so it does not appear if "All Sites" is selected.  This feature rates quite low for ease of discovery :)

comments.text:
Just to clarify, there is no ability to set a general "accept only as a first party" cookie permission.  This can only be set as an exception for individual sites, and then it will override whatever the global cookie permissions are.

So it would be set from the exceptions dialog (opened from the privacy pane), rather than on the privacy pane itself.  There is also the about:permissions page which we've talked about already, the cookie ask dialog, and on the page info security pane.
